comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: He invented a combination machine that could allegedly "travel on the ground with the smoothness and swiftness of a racing automobile or shoot into the air with the perfect equilibrium and ease of a swallow, and be poised there; navigate the ocean with the speed of a motor boat, or can be used as a submarine." (Tensas gazette., February 26, 1915, Page 3, "HAS NOVEL MACHINE- Inventor Says It Will Fly, Run, Swim and Dive.") More about the "Motor Goose" in en.wikisource.org/wiki/Page:Popular_Science_Monthly_Volum...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Sharpe claimed to be the great-grandson of the inventor of the "Sharpe's rifle". He invented also a device called "radiocameraphone", with which he could "detect" a meteorite at a depth of 1400 feet (according to Coon Mountain Controversies: Meteor Crater and the Development of Impact Theory by William Graves Hoyt, P. 228)
